programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Nevison confides in Kevin about the kidnappers' ransom demands, making the accountant realise the enormity of the situation he has created. His boss now faces two problems - raising the money and telling his ill wife their daughter has been abducted. Catherine's search for Tommy gains momentum when she receives a tip-off regarding his whereabouts, much to the concern of Claire, who thought her sister had put all that in the past, and things are strained when Catherine's grandson Ryan makes an unwelcome appearance at a family dinner. Sarah Lancashire stars, with Steve Pemberton, George Costigan, James Norton, Karl Davies, Siobhan Finneran and Joe Armstrong

Eventually, the medics realise the patients are mother and son - but why did she leave him wandering the streets by himself? Ella is up to her old tricks again, masterminding an off-licence robbery that ends up with four youngsters in casualty - but Ash still refuses to accept his daughter is as troubled as everyone else believes

programme.title: IceStationZebra
programme.desc: (1968, Literary Adaptation) An American atomic submarine commander races against time to reach a Soviet spy satellite that has crash-landed near a British research station in the Arctic - before Russian troops arrive to stake their claim to it. Adventure based on Alistair MacLean's novel, starring Rock Hudson, Ernest Borgnine, Jim Brown, Tony Bill and Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Home of the Year
programme.desc: The judges travel to Ireland's south-west coast to visit three very different properties in Co Cork all competing for the title. They begin at a bungalow in Glengarriff, which has been colourfully renovated by a couple who relocated to the area from London. Their second visit is to an energy-efficient split-level home that has been cut in to the Casteltownbere landscape, before they tour a renovated farm house and family home in Goleen

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines

programme.title: The Voice of Ireland

However, only one act will make it through to the quarter-finals, and continue in their quest to win a recording contract

programme.title: At Your Service

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes tries to make friends with Dermot's mother-in-law Hillary ahead of the baby's birth, and suggests they go out to dinner together. However, the evening comes to an abrupt end for the two feuding matriarchs when expectant mum Maria goes into labour, and the Browns are forced to rush her to hospital. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll

programme.title: Passion - A Would You Believe? Special
programme.desc: Documentary following the residents of Nicker, a village in rural Co Limerick, as they prepare for and stage Ireland's first 24-hour Passion play. Performed during Holy Week, almost all the community of farmers, nurses, care workers, builders, postmen, mechanics and teachers were mobilised by the local farmer to transform their village into a stage fit to present the unscripted drama - which transcended the participants' ideas of religion and left many who saw it stunned

programme.title: The Saturday Night Show
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Brendan O'Connor presents the entertainment show, joined each week by a panel of celebrity guests to provide a lively mix of chat, comedy and music. He also offers viewers the chance to win a prize

programme.title: Quicksilver
programme.desc: (1986, General Movie/Drama) A brash young stock trader, who has lost all his money and his parents' wealth playing the market, decides to drop out of the rat race and reinvent himself in a new career as a bicycle courier. He is happy to discover work has more to offer than just the empty pursuit of riches - so when he realises some of the other messengers have a sideline delivering drugs for a gangster, he is determined to stop it. Drama, with Kevin Bacon, Jamie Gertz and Rudy Ramos

programme.desc: A celebration of the 30th anniversary of the Australian soap, which launched the careers of stars Kylie Minogue, Guy Pearce, Margot Robbie, Delta Goodrem and Jason Donovan, who all reflect on their time in Neighbours. Hosted by Stefan Dennis and Tim Phillipps, who play Paul Robinson and his nephew Daniel respectively, the programme brings together an array of cast members who played some of the series' most popular and controversial characters, including Ian Smith and Anne Charleston (Harold and Madge Bishop), Mark Little (Joe Mangel) and Craig McLachlan (Henry Ramsay)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II

However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd

Also in that year, the women's liberation movement protested in Dublin against the ban on contraception, while abroad China was finally accepted into the United Nations and Idi Amin seized power in Uganda

programme.title: Abhainn
programme.desc: The programme exploring the country's rivers continues by examining local stories both ancient and new about the Bann, which flows north - through Bannbridge, Portadown, Toomebridge and Coleraine - to reach the Atlantic at Castlerock on the Derry coast. Taking viewers on a journey from source to sea, presenter Sinead Ni Churnain reveals the distinct characters of the Upper and Lower ends of the waterway, as well as the bit in between - Lough Neagh, the largest freshwater lake in the British and Irish Isles

The family are so often engaged in football-related activities that they are struggling to find time for homework, housework, playtime and friends - so Tony works with an educational specialist to advise them on how to manage their passion for sport and their busy lives

When a teenager attempts to steal his prized car, he ends up trying to reform the thief, making a connection with the boy's relatives and defending them from a street gang. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang

Crime drama set in the 1960s, starring Dennis Quaid, Michael Chiklis and Carrie-Anne Moss

programme.desc: Part two of two. A connection to a 16th-century murder seems to confirm someone is killing witches in Whitechapel. Chandler is on the case, but is there a malign influence at work within the team? The police station itself appears to pulsate with unexplained phenomena and even the usually hard-bitten Miles starts to ask questions. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Pioneers and Aviators - A Century of Irish Aviation
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the people whose vision and passion helped to forge the country's aviation industry. The programme begins by charting the first non-stop transatlantic flight from Newfoundland to Co Galway by John Alcock and Arthur Whitten Brown, and because of Ireland's position in Europe, it became a gateway to the Americas. The documentary also looks at the birth of Aer Lingus, and how the danger of air travel became more evident in the crashes of the 1960s

The pair develop a plan to keep the business afloat, which includes selling stock online. Last in the series

programme.title: Gangster Squad
programme.desc: (2013, Detective/Thriller) Premiere. A New York gangster brings his criminal organisation to Los Angeles in 1949, rapidly seizing control of the city's criminal activity and corrupting the authorities to ensure no one stands up to him. The chief of police discreetly sets up a secret task force with the intention of bringing the mobster to justice. Crime thriller, starring Josh Brolin, Ryan Gosling and Sean Penn

programme.title: Pioneers and Aviators - A Century of Irish Aviation
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documenting the rise of Tony Ryan's aircraft leasing company GPA after he decided that Aer Lingus needed a competitor. Ryanair was founded, and made its first flight out of Waterford in 1985, and despite strong resistance it went from strength to strength and was floated on the international stock markets. However, this put the company at risk until Michael O'Leary took it on a significant business and marketing journey that changed the face of European aviation for ever

However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD

Meanwhile, the other officers try to help Santiago conquer her cravings and give up smoking

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.title: American Crime

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law and Disorder in Philadelphia
programme.desc: First of two films in which the journalist joins local police in crime-ridden cities. He starts in Philadelphia, where there are around 400 homicides a year in an area of slightly more than 100 square miles, drug dealers work on almost every corner and it is considered normal to carry a gun. He witnesses both camaraderie and despair, and finds one officer who has won the trust of the local community

programme.title: Seven Days with
programme.desc: Reality series telling the real stories of the lives of celebrity couples. In the opening episode, super-rich Formula 1 heiress Tamara Ecclestone and her husband Jay Rutland welcome cameras into their Kensington home for a week as Tamara plans for her 30th Birthday, which is set to include a guest appearance from none other than Sean 'Puff Daddy' Combs. During the week they hire in a medium to tackle a supernatural problem, as Tamara suspects that their house is haunted. Jay and Tamara also reveal how life has changed since the arrival of their new baby, Sofia.

programme.title: Seven Days with
programme.desc: Reality series following the lives of some of the UK's favourite celebrity couples. This time, former JLS member JB Gill and his wife Chloe allow cameras into their home to see how they really live. We find out how the couple are preparing for the arrival of their new baby, including JB sacrificing his bachelor pad and extensive wardrobe space to make room for his new bride. JB also shows us around his ever-expanding farm, which he hopes will provide stability and the perfect environment to raise his new family.

programme.title: Seven Days with
programme.desc: Reality series which spends a week behind closed doors with some of the UK's favourite celebrity couples. In the second episode, former pop sensations Ritchie Neville of boy band 5ive and Natasha Hamilton of girl group Atomic Kitten let us in to their ever-expanding family home in Chester. programme.desc: Reality series which spends a week behind closed doors with celebrity couples. This time, singer and TV presenter Brian McFadden and his wife, model and DJ Vogue Williams, welcome cameras into their home and their hectic lives. Both stars are juggling busy careers in Ireland and the UK, with Brian working hard on the set of his new TV show and Vogue attending her latest photo shoot. We find out how the couple handle being apart and how it might affect their family plans. The week ends with Brian preparing to perform live for the first time in eight months at a charity event.
